solution.text:
Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2(\pi {r_ o}^2 - \pi {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2\pi \times \frac{_{j}_}2 \times _{{l*7}}_ + 2 \pi \times \frac{_{k}_}2 \times _{{l*7}}_ + 2\pi({\frac{_{j}_}2}^2 - {\frac{_{k}_}2}^2)\)
= _{{(22*j*l)+(22*k*l)+trunc(Decimal('0.5')*pi_val*((j**2)-(k**2)), 2)}}_\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= _{{(22*j*l)+(22*k*l)+trunc(Decimal('0.5')*pi_val*((j**2)-(k**2)), 2)}}_ \times 0.2\)
= Rs. _{{((22*j*l)+(22*k*l)+trunc(Decimal('0.5')*pi_val*((j**2)-(k**2)), 2)) * Decimal('0.2')}}_

content.text: A cylindrical pipe has an outer diameter of _{j}_ cm and an inner diameter of _{k}_ cm. Its length is _{{l*7}}_ cm. It needs to be painted on its outer and inner surfaces, as well as the rims. The cost of painting the pipe is Rs. 0.2 per \(cm^2\). What is the total cost of painting the pipe?
